result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rick William Hoffmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Upon pl to 15CF1549, Cts 1 & 3, Ct 2 DRI, 15CF548-Ct 1, Ct 2 DRI; 15CF1250-Cts 1 & 2, Ct 3 DRI, 15CF1251-DRI entirely, 16CF777-Cts 1-4, Ct 5 DRI. The State recommends prison; ss on amount and bifurcation.
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Case removed from electronic filing process

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense indicates that deft is in counseling and that none of these cases are in trial posture. Deft is about a quarter of the way done with treatment and asks for COP in January. The State indicates that a stipulated agreement is not necessary; defense is free to argue at SEH.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rick W Hoffman in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense is the first status after PTC on 16CF777. Deft was accepted into drug court but didn't have transportation back and forth in order to take advantage of drug court. The State has tendered an offer that deft wishes to accept. The Deft wishes to engage in treatment and defense asks for STC in about 60 days. The State takes no position.

BTC: Deft to report for drug testing as soon as he leaves court today.  Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  There is a 5th file to be added to this hearing.  All cases should track together.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Defendant is being considered for Drug Court.
  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett A Ekes in court.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Atty Ekes indicates that defendant had the date mixed up.  Defendant has been evaluated for Drug Court and parties are waiting on decision.
BTC:  Adj.
  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes. W, Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Walgreens, except for restitution purposes.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rick William Hoffmann in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
